## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages("ggmap")
install.packages('devtools')
install_github('dkahle/ggmap')
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(ggmap)
library(dplyr)
raw_data <- read.csv("Public_wifi_location_seoul.csv",header=T, fileEncoding = 'euc-kr',encoding = 'utf-8') 
raw_data[,7] = as.numeric(raw_data[,7])
raw_data[,8] = as.numeric(raw_data[,8])

loc_data <- filter(raw_data, lon < 40 && lon > 30)
loc_data <- filter(raw_data, lat > 120 && lat < 130)

bus_data <- read.csv("Bus_location.csv",header=T, fileEncoding = 'euc-kr',encoding = 'utf-8') 

```

```{r}
library('devtools')
library('ggmap')
register_google(key='')

```

```{r}
map <- get_map(location='seoul', zoom=11, source='google', maptype='roadmap')
ggmap(map) + geom_point(data=loc_data, aes(x=lat, y=lon), color = "skyblue", alpha = 0.05, size=0.5) + geom_point(data=bus_data, aes(x=x, y=y), color = "red", alpha = 0.05, size=0.5)
```
